settings.title:
Charitable giving.
An investment in us all.

settings.quote: “The true measure of a society can be found in how it treats its most vulnerable members.”
settings.author: - Mahatma Gandhi
settings.text: Wellness is more than great skincare. It’s also how we treat each other and the Earth. That’s why we’ve invested in humanity-driven charities from day one. Giving isn’t a public relations game to us - it’s central to our families and this business. No matter how you give or how much, we hope you’ll join us.

settings.heading: Coombs Outdoors
settings.copy: Jackson Hole is known for its natural beauty and world-class outdoor sports. However, there is a large population of children of low-income families who do not have access to the same opportunities as their peers. In an effort to create a healthy community where all children thrive, Coombs Outdoors provides year-round outdoor programming for youth from Kindergarten through high school graduation.

settings.heading: Jackson Hole Land Trust
settings.copy: The Jackson Hole Land Trust is a private nonprofit founded in 1980. Their vision is a legacy of protected open spaces, wildlife habitat, working lands, and community spaces across Northwest Wyoming that inspire current and future generations.

settings.heading: Teton Youth & Family Services
settings.copy: TYFS, an independent private non-profit organization, has been serving children and families in Teton County and beyond since 1977, when Van Vleck House first opened its doors as a drop-in center for teens. TYFS is now the umbrella organization for three entities that are crucial to child welfare in our community and state: Van Vleck House, which includes a Group Home and Crisis Center and Court Diversion Services; Red Top Meadows, which provides residential treatment and wilderness programs for adolescent males; and the Hirschfield Center for Children which provides programs for families and children as well as forensic interviews for children subject to neglect and/or abuse.

settings.heading: One22
settings.copy: One22 exists to invest in and support people living in Greater Jackson, Wyoming who are facing health, financial, and cultural challenges. They provide a range of relief services including utility bill assistance, mental health support, food delivery, and more.  We're honored to be able to continue to support such a valuable community organization.

settings.heading: Old Bills Fun Run
settings.copy: Old Bills is a collaborative of Jackson Hole, Wyoming nonprofits working together and sharing funds for various causes. These funds are busy feeding the hungry, supporting the sick and elderly, teaching kids to read, protecting wildlife, building affordable housing, enriching our lives through the arts, and touching the lives of everyone in Teton County. We are thrilled to be able to support such a great event again.

settings.heading: World Central Kitchen
settings.copy: World Central Kitchen serves chef-prepared meals to communities impacted by natural disasters and prolonged humanitarian crises while also seeking to advance human and environmental health by offering access to professional culinary training and improving food security.

settings.heading: Movember
settings.copy: A leading charity in the face of Men’s health focusing on maximizing men’s health and longevity to prevent premature death and overall wellness.

settings.heading: Breaking Code Silence
settings.copy: Breaking Code Silence is a nonprofit aimed at ending child abuse in residential facilities by way of wilderness-based therapy programs, residential treatment centers, therapeutic boarding schools, group homes, boot camps, and faith-based academies.

settings.heading: Old Bills Fun Run
settings.copy: Old Bills is a collaborative of Jackson Hole, Wyoming nonprofits working together and sharing funds for various causes. These funds are busy feeding the hungry, supporting the sick and elderly, teaching kids to read, protecting wildlife, building affordable housing, enriching our lives through the arts, and touching the lives of everyone in Teton County.

settings.heading: Share Our Strength’s No Kid Hungry Campaign
settings.copy: In the wake of the coronavirus pandemic, 1 in 6 kids could face hunger this year. No Kid Hungry is working to end childhood hunger by helping launch and improve programs that give all kids the healthy food they need to thrive. No Kid Hungry is a campaign of Share Our Strength, an organization committed to ending hunger and poverty.

settings.heading: NAACP Legal Defense Fund
settings.copy: The NAACP Legal Defense and Educational Fund, Inc. is America’s premier legal organization fighting for racial justice. Through litigation, advocacy, and public education, LDF seeks structural changes to expand democracy, eliminate disparities, and achieve racial justice that fulfills the promise of equality for all Americans.

settings.heading: ACLU Foundation
settings.copy: The ACLU aims to preserve and extend constitutionally guaranteed rights to people who have historically been denied their rights on the basis of race. Their Racial Justice Programs aim to dismantle systemic racism and to repair centuries of harm inflicted on communities of color.

settings.heading: NYU Langone Hospital
settings.copy: Frontline healthcare heroes at NYU Langone Hospital asked us if The Good would help their skin, chapped from wearing PPE gear all day everyday during COVID-19. We shipped them bottles of The Good to prevent cracking and protect their skin health.

settings.heading: Cultivate Ability
settings.copy: Cultivate Ability fosters inclusive workplaces in Jackson, Wyoming for differently-abled community members. They work to create inclusive work environments that benefit the employer, employees and the greater community.

settings.heading: One22
settings.copy: One22 exists to invest in and support people living in Greater Jackson, Wyoming who are facing health, financial, and cultural challenges. They provide a range of relief services including utility bill assistance, mental health support, food delivery, and more.

settings.heading: Nature Conservancy
settings.copy: The Nature Conservancy works to preserve our natural ecosystem, including our natural resources and endangered wildlife. It has protected more than 119,000,000 acres of land and thousands of miles of rivers worldwide.

settings.heading: Pediatric Cancer Research Foundation
settings.copy: PCRF supports groundbreaking research to provide better treatment and cures for children with cancer. They also fund vital family support services and advocate for childhood cancer education and awareness.

settings.video: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/77825176" width="640" height="360" frameborder="0" allow="autoplay; fullscreen" allowfullscreen></iframe>
settings.heading: Pencils of Promise
settings.copy: PoP believes that every child should have access to quality education. They work across the globe to build schools and create quality educational programming to increase literacy rates.

settings.heading: B Corporations believe in more than profit.
settings.copy: Instead of promises that are tough to fact check, we opted for accountability. The B Corp designation confirms that from wild harvesting to packaging to distribution, every stage of our production and labor practices meet the highest standards of social and environmental responsibility.

Our mountain community relies heavily on tourism and when the COVID-19 pandemic hit, many people in our area were worried about their family's livelihood. Caldera + Lab generously contributed $25,000 to One22 Resource Center to help support the Greater Teton community during this time of crisis.
settings.name: - Sharel Lund, One22 Executive Director
